Work in progress, not to be used for production work.

## Installation

You can install the development version of cbsopendata from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("edwindj/cbsopendata")
```

## Example


```{r setup}
library(cbsopendata)
```

To retrieve a list of tables:


```{r}
dfs <- list_dataflows()
dfs[,1:5] |> 
  head()
```

To retrieve a dataflow structure:

```{r}
dataflow_ref <- dfs$ref[4]
print(dataflow_ref)

dsd <- get_dataflow_structure(ref = dataflow_ref)
dsd
```

To retrieve data use `get_data`

```{r}
data <- get_data(agencyID=dsd$agencyID, id = dsd$id, pivot="Topics")
head(data)
```

Or get the underlying observations with `get_observations`

```{r}
obs <- get_observations(id="DF_37230ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT")
```

```{r}
head(obs)
```
